Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a land habitat, such as a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot, and show different types of living things found there with reasonable accuracy.
The student can draw a water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake, including several appropriate living things.
The student can illustrate different types of plants within the habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants, distinguishing between them with some clarity.
The student can illustrate and label different types of animals in the habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams, with most labels accurate and correctly placed.
The student can organize the drawing in a way that mostly clearly represents the habitats and living things.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently compare and show patterns of plant and animal diversity across different habitats (e.g., may overlook diversity in smaller organisms or fail to highlight a certain pattern).
The student may have minor gaps in labeling or mislabel a few living things (e.g., labeling a bush as a tree due to size confusion or missing a label entirely).
The student might struggle to accurately illustrate complex or unfamiliar living things in a detailed way, sometimes resorting to generic shapes (e.g., clams could be drawn too simplistically).
